info.title: MOKA API
info.description: MokaPOS core API documentation written in swagger-2.0 specification

tags.name: Types of Moka Apps
tags.description:
Moka APIs let developers to create applications for various integration. Depending on the purpose of your app, it can be considered as a public or private app. The definition of each can be seen below:

  • Public apps are meant for developers who want to distribute their applications to many merchants of Moka
  • Private apps are meant for developers who want to build an integration specifically for a certain merchant or for personal use

There are several differences between public and private apps:

Public Apps Private Apps
Visibility in AppMarketplace Visible Not Visible
Status in Developer Dashboard Published In Review

Note:

  • The status In Review still allow developers to use the application and it will still functionally working as expected
  • If you want to make your application visible in AppMarketplace, please contact Moka directly by emailing to support@mokapos.com

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
access_token

Access token for doing API request

Security scheme type: OAuth2
implicit OAuth Flow
Authorization URL: /oauth/authorize
Scopes:
  • customer - Access merchant customers
  • library - Access merchant library
  • profile - Access merchant profile
  • report - Access merchant reports
  • transaction - Access merchant transaction
  • checkout - Create checkout
  • checkout_api - Forward orders to Moka app
  • sales_type - Create/Modify advanced orderings sales type for an outlet.

tags.name: Changelog
tags.description:
These logs document the changes in Moka APIs including the supplemental and versioned changes.

Changelog history

22-06-2023

Features:

Remove usage of below fields for following API:

  • GET getEventsV1 API

  • POST createSubscriptionV1 API

  • GET getSubscriptionsV1 API

  • PATCH updateSubscriptionV1 API

  • DELETE deleteSubscriptionV1 API

03-02-2023

Features:

Item Summaries API:

  • GET listItemSummariesV1 Add more explanation and detailed description regarding the API

Latest Transasction API:

  • GET showLatestTransactionsV3 Add attributes exclude_bundle(bool)

16-01-2023

Features:

Item Library API:

  • POST uploadPOSImageV1 Add 422 case error example.
  • POST uploadEcommerceImageV1 Add 422 case error example.
  • DELETE deleteItemV1 Add handling and example for 422 error.
  • Add ecommerce related attribute to GET listItemsV1.

11-01-2023

Features:

Item Adjusment API:

  • Remove attribute in_stock (string) for POST createItemAdjustmentV1.

02-01-2023

Features:

Item Library API:

  • POST uploadPOSImageV1 The uploadPOSImageV1 API has been introduced to create items in MOKA library.
  • POST uploadEcommerceImageV1 The uploadEcommerceImageV1 API has been introduced to create items in MOKA library.
  • POST createItemV1: Add attribute image on create item for POS item image creation.

07-12-2022

Features:

Item Library API:

  • POST createItemV1 The createItemV1 API has been introduced to create items in MOKA library.
  • PUT updateItemV1 The updateItemV1 API has been introduced to update items in MOKA library.
  • DELETE deleteItemV1 The deleteItemV1 API has been introduced to delete items in MOKA library.

22-11-2022

Features:

Advanced Ordering Description:

  • Change the status on order cancel by cashier from "cancelled" to "rejected"

01-11-2022

Features:

Report Invoice Detail V2 API:

  • GET reportInvoiceDetailV2 API can be query by invoice_id (string)

Features:

Shifts API:

  • The entire Shifts API has been removed.

SalesType API

  • The createSalesType API has been introduced to create new sales type.

24-06-2020

Features:

Subscription API:

  • The getEventsV1 API has been introduced to retrieve events available in MOKA.

  • The getSubscriptionsV1 API has been introduced to retrieve the subscriptions which you registered.

  • The createSubscriptionV1 API has been introduced to subscribe to an event.

  • The updateSubscriptionV1 API has been introduced to update the subscriptions which you registered.

  • The deleteSubscriptionV1 API has been introduced to destroy the subscriptions which you registered.

tags.name: Loyalties
tags.description:
Loyalty Program is related to business.

These are the terminology of loyalty

Customer and Merchant

Merchant is the owner of a business, and a user of Moka App. Customer will do transactions to merchant. There are 2 kind of customers, loyalty and non-loyalty.

A loyalty customer must have phone number

Program

When a merchant create a loyalty, he needs to first create a program. Currently we support 2 programs

  1. Gain points from money you spent (Rp/IDR amount)
  2. Gain points from item you bought

Program Rules/Earning Rules

This is how a loyalty member get points. For example, by spending 1,000 IDR you get 1 points loyalty. Also, new member can get initial point reward when joining loyalty program

Program Rewards

You can get these following rewards configuration:

  1. % discount on total sale. You will get % price cut based on total calculation of a transaction.
  2. Rp discount on total sale. You will get Rp discount based on total calculation of a transaction.
  3. % discount on specific item. You will get % price cut of a item.

Customer validation code

Validate customer phone number by sending validation code

tags.name: Advanced Orderings
tags.description:
Advanced orderings is an API that forwards the data to our mobile application. Using this API, 3rd party app can create a checkout using Moka

There are various 3rd party which can consume this API, for example food delivery app and e-commerce.

The diagram can be described as follows:

  1. 3rd party app create order using Moka external API
  2. Moka system will forward the data into Moka mobile
  3. Cashier will decide whether the order can be fulfilled or not. If the order can be fulfilled, the cashier will accept order. If it is not, the cashier will cancel order.
  4. Depending on situation, Moka will give notification either `accept order` or `cancel order`
  5. If you are food delivery, you can start searching for driver. Invoke Moka API for sending the driver data to Moka. The data will be forwarded to Moka app
  6. If you are e-commerce, cashier will give data about the expedition number. Moka will send notification regarding expedition data to 3rd party app
  7. Cashier will complete order. With this operation, the order data will be treated as Moka's checkout data (It will deduct inventory data of merchant and add transaction in Moka's dashboard). Also, 3rd party app will be notified.

Callbacks

Moka will notify 3rd party app when there is some operation related to advanced ordering

Event Description Example Body
Accept Order The cashier accept the order, and decided to fulfill the order. POST /your-callback-url
{
"outlet_id": 123,
"application_order_id": "IOS-123456",
"status": "accepted"
}
Complete Order The cashier complete the order POST /your-callback-url
{
"outlet_id": 123,
"application_order_id": "IOS-123456",
"status": "completed"
}
Cancel Order The cashier cancel the order.


Note: Any order cancelled by cashier, its status will be changed into "rejected"
 POST /your-callback-url
{
"outlet_id": 123,
"application_order_id": "IOS-123456",
"status": "rejected"
}
Update Expedition Order The cashier input the expedition POST /your-callback-url
{
"outlet_id": 123,
"application_order_id": "IOS-123456",
"name": "MokaExpress",
"airway_bill_number": "AMG-123456"
}

Step-by-Step Guide to Integrate Utilizing Advanced Orderings API

Please refer to Advanced Orderings Getting Started doc to learn more about the requirements for the integration process.

tags.name: Oauth
tags.description:
The flows is described as follows:

  1. The owner of business (which uses Moka) open the App Market
  2. The owner see list of apps available in Moka
  3. The user click get started to authorize the application
  4. The backoffice redirect the user to the authorization page
  5. The authorization page shows modal to owner
  6. The owner then click allow if they permit the requested permissions.
  7. The owner will be redirected to the 3rd party application, with the temporary grant token named `code` as query parameter. At this point, owner will access page in 3rd party app.
  8. 3rd party app need to exchange temporary token `code` into access token, using the `/oauth/token` API
  9. Moka server will return access token that can be used by 3rd party app to fetch data
  10. 3rd party app can start to access the API

tags.name: Checkout API
tags.description:
Checkout API is an API that allows merchants to send the transaction data from external source to Mokas Backoffice.

If the transaction includes discounted item, there are some restrictions to follow:

  1. If it is a cash discount, the information should be passed in the discount block
  2. If it is a percentage discount, the information should be passed in the item block based on the item that contains the discount

tags.name: Modification
tags.description: API for modification are API that allows merchants to supdate data to Mokas Backoffice.

status_code.type: One of the order status codes

get.description:
Retrieves an order's status. Required permissions: `checkout`

This will return the orders status code, the status code is a predefined set of code strings described as follows:

Order Status Code Short Description Description
"0" INCOMING The order notification was sent to the merchant and is waiting for the merchant to either accept or decline the incoming order.
"1" ACCEPTED The order was accepted but not yet processed by the merchant.
"2" COMPLETED The merchant has completely processed the order.
"3" CANCELLED The order was cancelled by the order issuer using the cancelOrderV1 API.
"4" EXPIRED The order notification was sent to the merchant but the merchant didnt accept or decline it within the expiration time window.
"5" REJECTED The merchant declined the incoming order.
"6" DELIVERED The processed order has been delivered.
In rare cases, this API can return an empty string which means that currently the order is in an invalid state, you can try again at a later time to get the correct value of the order status.

new_member_point.description: How many points customer will get when they register as a loyalty member for the first time

program_revision.description: Counter about how many this program has been altered

inactive_since.description: when the program has been deactivated

reset_since.description: when the program has been reset

created_by.description: The name of creator. If you asked about ID, yes we only provide name.

updated_by.description: The name of updater. If you asked about ID, yes we only provide name.

deleted_at.description: Currently we do not support delete loyalty, so please just ignore this

deleted_by.description: Currently we do not support delete loyalty, so please just ignore this

is_sent_validation_code.description: `true` if customer need to input their verification code when registering as loyalty member

type.description: Type of earning method. Currently it only support `SPENDING`, but it can be changed further during Moka features development

amount.description: Amount of spending needed to gain points. If the `type` is `SPENDING`, then this field represents amount rupiah

reward_type.description: Type of reward. It can be `TOTAL_SALES` or `ITEM`

discount.description:
Amount of discount based on `discount_type`.
If `discount_type` equals `AMOUNT` then this represent value in rupiah. Otherwise, this represents percentage

max_discount_amount.description: Amount of discount can be applied to a transactions, in rupiah (after calculation)

min_purchase_amount.description: Amount of purchase needed so this reward can be applied to a transactions, in rupiah

created_by.description: The name of creator. If you asked about ID, yes we only provide name.

updated_by.description: The name of updater. If you asked about ID, yes we only provide name.

reward_items.description:
Only applies if reward_type=ITEM.
NOTE: we use name instead of id in variant, item, or category, since some items or category have different ids but same name.

category_name.description: Applies only if `type` equals `CATEGORY`\nGet reward from any items belong to category name

item_name.description: Applies only if `type` equals `ITEM`\nGet reward from any items belong to item name

items.description: Applies only if `type` equals `ITEM` or `ITEM_VARIANT`.\nGet reward from any items belong to variants name. If the variants is not limited, then it would return `*`

redeem_point.description: How much points required to redeem this reward

is_deleted.description: `true` if the reward has been deleted

data.description: Sync Bill data

guid.description: GUID of the device that created the bill

createdAt.description: Timestamp at which the bill was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp at which the bill was last updated

synchronizedAt.description: Timestamp at which the Bill did the last sync or the latest timestamp when the device fetched data from Moka for the given bill

status.description: Bill status. Possible status values are: PENDING, COMPLETE or CANCELLED

tableId.description: Table ID for the bill. TableID is 0 if it is not a dine in order

cancelledBy.description: Name of server that cancelled the bill

cancelledAt.description: Timestamp at which the given Bill was cancelled

cancelledReason.description: Notes on why the bill was cancelled

serveBy.description: Server ID of the server that managed the bill

pax.description: Server ID of the server that managed the bill

receiptNo.description: Receipt number of the bill after checkout

bill_detail.description: Displays detailed information about the bills including item and table details. Enable the deep parameter to get this information

server_name.description: Name of the server that managed the bill

updatedAt.description: Timestamp at which the bill was last updated

bill_sub_total_amount.description: Subtotal amount of the bill before taxes

bill_total_amount.description: Grand total amount of the bill

items.description: List of all the items purchased in the bill

quantity.description: The quantity purchased for the given item

sales_type.description: Sales type for the given item

synchronizedAt.description: Timestamp at which the Bill did the last sync or the latest timestamp when the device fetched data from Moka for the given bill

modifier_options.description: List of all modifier options used

active_modifiers.description: Item modifiers that were used for the given item for the bill

track_stock.description: Flag to indicate whether this item variant is being tracked for stock

item_variants.description: Item variants that were used for the given item for the bill

createdByDevice.description: GUID of the device that created the bill

updatedByDevice.description: GUID of the device that last updated the bill

cancelledByName.description: Name of the server that cancelled the bill

serveByName.description: Name of the server that managed the bill

parameters.description: Number of elements on a page

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorts the result in ascending or descending order based on a given request parameter. Format of parameter: param_to_sort_by, ASC/DESC. Example: updated_at,DESC

parameters.name: last_pull
parameters.description: Returns only the bills that were synced at given timestamp

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Returns only the bills that have bill status according to the given status value. Valid status values are: PENDING, COMPLETE, CANCELLED

parameters.name: dine_in_only
parameters.description: Returns only bills that are assigned with a table. By default, dine_in_only is false and will return all bills (assigned with and without a table)

parameters.name: deep
parameters.description: Returns item details that include informatio of item_variants and item_modifiers nof the bill.

get.description:
Returns all promos on the outlets that the user has access to. Required permissions: `library`

NOTE: `promo_status` may be displayed as active even though the current date and time is not between `promo_start_date` and `promo_end_date`.

If a promo is not deactivated in Backoffice and current date is not in range between `start_date` and `end_date`, then `promo_status` will be Active. However, we treat this type of promo as Inactive in Backoffice. Therefore, please beware as these promos are already expired.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Flag whether to list only active or inactive promos. If empty, list both active and inactive.

get.description:
Required permissions: `library`. Item Summaries summarize item variant's stock at the beginning of the day, end of day, and sum of every transaction that happened
            within a certain date period.
            A record of summary will be created for an item variant for this condition :

- An item variant is created with track_stock true
- An item variant is updated to track_stock true and never been set to true before
- A transaction for an item variant is created.
